sentences.en: All new fashion starts out as a reaction against existing convention.
sentences.cn: 所有新时尚都是从打破现有常规开始的。

sentences.en: Gucci will be holding fashion shows to present their autumn collection.
sentences.cn: 古奇将举办时装发布会推出他们的秋装系列。

sentences.en: Hats like that just aren’t the fashion.
sentences.cn: 那样的帽子不流行。

sentences.en: He burst onto the fashion scene in the early 1980s.
sentences.cn: 20世纪80年代初他突然在时尚界活跃起来。

sentences.en: he could read after a fashion.
sentences.cn: 他勉强识点儿字。

sentences.en: He was awarded the OBE in 1990 for services to fashion.
sentences.cn: 凭着对时装业的杰出贡献，他于1990年荣获英帝国官佐勋衔。

sentences.en: His ideas are coming back into fashion (= they are becoming popular again ) .
sentences.cn: 他的观点又流行起来。

sentences.en: His ideas are coming back into fashion (= they are becoming popular again ).
sentences.cn: 他的观点又流行起来。

sentences.en: I'm not a fashion victim; I stick to what suits me.
sentences.cn: 我不是一味赶时髦的人，我只穿适合自己的服装。

sentences.en: In the early seventies I wore false eyelashes, as was the fashion.
sentences.cn: 70年代初我戴假睫毛，这在当时是时尚。

sentences.en: Many of the clothes come from the world's top fashion houses.
sentences.cn: 这些服装中有很多出自世界顶级时装设计公司。

sentences.en: Perhaps they could sit down and discuss things in a civilised fashion.
sentences.cn: 也许他们可以坐下来心平气和地商量事情。

sentences.en: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion.
sentences.cn: 请大家有秩序地离开大楼。

sentences.en: Self-help books are all the fashion (= they are very fashionable ) .
sentences.cn: 自助类的书籍很流行。

sentences.en: Self-help books are all the fashion (= they are very fashionable ).
sentences.cn: 自助类的书籍很流行。

sentences.en: She could not maintain her balance and moved in a wobbly fashion.
sentences.cn: 她无法保持平衡，走路颤颤巍巍。

sentences.en: She sings after a fashion.
sentences.cn: 她勉强会唱一点

sentences.en: she took servants for granted after the fashion of wealthy and pampered girls.
sentences.cn: 她像那些富有而娇气十足的女孩子一样，认为有佣人是理所当然的。

sentences.en: She was educated — after a fashion — at home.
sentences.cn: 她算得上是受过教育——家庭教育。

sentences.en: She will be working out her problems in her own fashion (= in the way that she usually does this ) .
sentences.cn: 她会以自己的方式来解决她的问题。

sentences.en: Their music will never go out of fashion (= stop being fashionable ) .
sentences.cn: 他们的音乐永不过时。

sentences.en: Their music will never go out of fashion (= stop being fashionable ).
sentences.cn: 他们的音乐永不过时。

sentences.en: Their range of leisurewear is aimed at fashion-conscious 13 to 25 year-olds.
sentences.cn: 他们的休闲服系列瞄准的是追求时髦的13到25岁青少年。

sentences.en: There are 20 full-colour pages of fashion for men.
sentences.cn: 书中有20张有关男性时尚的彩色插页。

sentences.en: There is another drug called DHE that works in a similar fashion.
sentences.cn: 另外还有一种叫DHE的药物，药效也差不多。

sentences.en: Vivienne Westwood has scaled the heights of fashion's hall of fame.
sentences.cn: 薇薇恩·韦斯特伍德已成为时装界的翘楚。

sentences.en: We are becoming one of the market leaders in the fashion industry.
sentences.cn: 我们正在成为时装业的领军者之一。

sentences.en: Young people are very concerned with fashion
sentences.cn: 年轻人很关注时尚。

sentences.en: Young people are very concerned with fashion.
sentences.cn: 年轻人很关注时尚。

words.tran_cn: 流行的；时髦的；上流社会的
创流行的人；赶时髦的人

phrases.tran_cn: 模仿；像…一样；按照…的方式

phrases.phrase: after a fashion 或 in a fashion
phrases.tran_cn: 勉强，马马虎虎：多少有一点儿，特指在某种受限制的范围内
时样，服装风格；流行款式
马马虎虎；勉强；多少还…一点

trans.tran_en: something that is popular or thought to be good at a particular time
to shape or make something, using your hands or only a few tools
